content.rendered:
By Ruth Carol Atieno

Fluke 376 FC Clamp Meter is an advanced tool, with a wide range of specification, used by electricians to safely and efficiently troubleshoot for industrial and commercial buildings.

The first interesting thing about it is that with the help of Fluke Connect it can be operated wireless. This means that, through Bluetooth connectivity, you are able to log and monitor measurements without being close to the equipment.

The clamp meter is small and can be easily operated with one hand when switching to the different frequencies. The portability factor here is also made easy.

Fluke 376 has multiple functions.

  • It can measure AC up to 1000 Volts and DC also up to 1000 Volts.
  • It can also measure up to 1000 Amps DC and AC.
  • Measures MilliVolts DC
  • It does capacitance and resistance

The device also has proprietary inrush measurement technology which has the ability to filter out noise hence capturing motor starting current exactly as the circuit protection sees it.

The clamp meter works with a set of batteries and therefore you do not have to look for a separate source of power to operate and you can use any Bluetooth device for your Bluetooth display.

It also comes with an iFlex cable which expands the measurement range to 2500 A AC. The cables also provides increased display flexibility with its ability to measure large sized conductors and improved wire access.

Fluke 376 also comes with a TPAK magnetic hanging strap which is durable and has a very strong gripping ability. These straps enables you to hang the device on hooks, nails etc.

You might be wondering whether the device will work well if you buy it from the United States and use it overseas. It works perfectly well everywhere.

In my opinion, with the accuracy and the fact that Fluke 376 Clamp Meter is easy to operate. I would recommend this to any electrician out here, whether you are an industrial or a commercial electrician, this tool here is perfect for you.

This product here is great quality!

Buy Here
